column4: Guys I've tried playing NaCl games like 'Bastion' and 'Pocket legends' but they keep saying there's problems with my graphics card not supporting OpenGL. I just got my new Lenovo H330 computer with an i5  intel proccesor. Does Ubuntu not support it or something?
i5s use optimus tech, get ironhide, google it
You'll have to explain that a little further?
you need this: https://launchpad.net/~mj-casalogic/+archive/ironhide
Ah thanks I'll add that PPA. Which packages do I need to install from it?

Basically, whats going on is that the laptop uses graphics switching to swap between onboard and card graphics. Nvidia never released how it works, so thats a bit of inventive reverse engineering. The package is called ironhide
Ah okay thanks I'll install it now
Okay I installed that package and restarted. I tried one of the NaCl games and it worked! But I've also tried two others and they still don't work.
those are working on your onboard graphics. To use card graphics, you need to prefix the run command with 'optirun'
But I don't have any graphics card present in the computer. I wanted to use the built in CPU ones.
oh, then it's working as intended. What errors are the other 2 spitting out?
I'm going to have to go AFK for a moment I'll notify you of my arrival. Won't be a minute.
Sorry I'm back now. What's going wrong do you think?
no clue, which is why I asked what errors you're getting
oops I said that before but I forgot to include your name so you probably didn't see it.
yeah, that is a bit of a problem in high-use channels like this
Before installing ironside 'pocket legends' didn't work at all. Now that it is installed it sometimes works when starting it up. Other times it says your graphics card failed to inilitze
can you put your /etc/xorg.conf on pastebin for me?
No such file is present
that's pretty much impossible... how are you trying to get it? with "gedit /../../etc/xorg.conf"?
When installing ironside I prompted me to select a model. I think I may have selected 'Acer' by accident. I'm pretty such I didn't though. How can I go back and check that?
